intro: Giorgiella, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Giorgiella is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments.
